audio_description: Today we’re making Lucknowi Chicken Biryani, also known as Awadhi Chicken Biryani. It’s a lightly spiced biryani with a very rich flavor. First, we’ll take half a cup of oil.

audio_description: We’ll lightly fry the onions to golden. Once they are fried, add 1 kg chicken. As soon as we add it, increase the flame to high and mix the chicken well with the oil. Fry it nicely on high flame.

audio_description: Add 5 cloves. With just these whole spices, we'll roast the chicken until the raw smell of ginger-garlic goes away. Continue mixing on high flame. This biryani uses yellow chili powder which adds excellent flavor.

audio_description: Add 2 tbsp of yellow chili powder and 1 tbsp of red chili powder. Mix the chicken well with these spices for 1 to 1.5 minutes. Now reduce the flame to low and add 3/4 cup of whisked curd — about 150 grams.

audio_description: To make biryani masala, take 10g green cardamom, 10g mace (javitri), and half a nutmeg. Grind them into a fine aromatic powder. Add ½ tsp of this biryani masala into the pan.

audio_description: Now mix the curd thoroughly with the chicken. Once it is well mixed, increase the flame again. Once the chicken boils nicely, add about half a cup of water. Let it cook well.

audio_description: Add 3–4 drops of sweet ittar (aromatic essence). Cover and cook the chicken for at least 15 minutes on medium to low flame. Cook it 80–90% through. The rest will cook with the rice later.

audio_description: Drain the remaining water from the rice and layer it on top. After layering all the rice, pour the saved rogan mixture over it. Add a bit of orange food color. You can also soak saffron in milk and add that.

audio_description: Cover and cook the biryani on low flame for 20–25 minutes. After 20 minutes, remove the lid. This biryani doesn’t use coriander, mint leaves, or fried onions — just enjoy it as is.
